purpose.p: These views are complementary to the assembly structure and bill of materials views that are the primary focus for manufacturing (realization) of a product (see Part definition relationship). The breakdown may be of a design for a part () or a realized part (). For any product, more than one breakdown may exist to support the various different activities.
purpose.example: Both the MSG3 and RCMII reliability-centred maintenance methods require a functional breakdown of the product to be analyzed.
Damage control onboard ships requires a zonal breakdown.
purpose.p: Each breakdown is identified through the breakdown entity. This is a sub-type of product and has versions and definitions represented by breakdown_version, and breakdown_definition. The breakdown entity represents the root of the breakdown structure and has a classification associated with it to identify the type of breakdown, i.e. system, functional, zonal, bill of materials, etc.
The breakdown is related to the product that is the subject of the breakdown through the breakdown_of entity.
The breakdown hierarchy comprises breakdown elements, which are sub types of product, product_version and product_view_definition, and hierarchical relationships between the elements.

The relationships are represented by breakdown_element_usage entities which is a type of breakdown_element_definition. They relate a breakdown_definition to one or more product_definitions that are element definitions of its top level constituents. These in turn may be related recursively, also by breakdown_element_usage, to other product_definitions to form a hierarchy. The breakdown_component_usage has an additional attribute that, regardless of its position in hierarchy, relates it directly to the breakdown_definition. This permits an element to be used in more than one breakdown.

The model provides specific entities for the product, product_version, and product_definitions for the elements of each class of breakdown that it supports. These are named after the class. For example, for the "physical" class the entities physical_element, physical_element_version, and physical_element_definition are used.

The model provides addition types of product_definition_relationship to support relationships specific to certain classes of breakdown. These include breakdown_context, breakdown_element_realization, and in_zone.

inscope.li: the identification of the breakdowns of a product or product_as_individual;
the identification of the elements that comprise the breakdown;
the identification of parent-child relationships between breakdown elements;
the relationships between elements in different breakdowns.
the identification of the items within a zone;

outscope.li: all product views whose components have no parent-child relationship;
product lists such as bill of materials.

definition.def: A breakdown is a partitioning of a product into a set of related elements to support engineering, analysis and other activities that may be performed in relation to the product. These breakdowns are explicit, parent-child views of the product elements.

uof.name: Breakdown
uof.description: The Breakdown UoF specifies the definitional information for the concepts of breakdown identification and relationships between breakdown elements.

uof.name: Breakdown_Element_Realization
uof.description: The Breakdown_Element_Usage UoF specifies the definitional information for the concept of identification of the way in which a breakdown element is realized.

uof.name: System_Breakdown
uof.description: The System_Breakdown UoF specifies the definitional information for the concepts of system breakdown views according to the system hierarchy of a product.

uof.name: Physical_Breakdown
uof.description: The Physical_Breakdown UoF specifies the definitional information for the concepts of breakdown views according to the physical realization of a product.

uof.name: Zonal_Breakdown
uof.description: The Zonal_Breakdown UoF specifies the definitional information for the concepts of breakdown views according to the spatial layout of a product.

uof.name: Functional_Breakdown
uof.description: The Functional_Breakdown UoF specifies the the definitional information for the concepts of breakdown views according to the behaviour or action of a product.
